intro: Corunastylis striata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved star sedge, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and narrow, linear leaves. Its flowers are small and clustered in spikelets, typically appearing in late spring to early summer. Corunastylis striata is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or swampy areas.
